tweets.text: @davemh72 @SianieRoo @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK The whole story stinks, literally but this is a health hazard

@SianieRoo @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK @JuliaBradbury I really don't believe in conspiracies but something isn't sitting right over this . At least two other landfills closed over complaints and breaches yet the most complained about one isn't .

Why do you lie @ClareDinnisEA &say you‚Äôre doing everything to u can when you have not financially penalised them or revoked their permit despite 5 new permit breaches released today? #stopthestink @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK @JuliaBradbury https://t.co/QKk7QinZsi
@lauraepolicy @EnvAgency Fixed it. You're welcome @thetimes. https://t.co/SlDWQoFAuO

What a beautiful day in #Cumbria today üå§Ô∏è 

Our field teams are mowing the flood defences by the river Kent downstream from #Kendal to keep the banks in tip top condition. 

The banks are walked beforehand to check for any nesting birds üê¶ https://t.co/OSnbAhkPSV

A community in Staffordshire are living with doors & windows taped up.Nose bleeds, breathing issues, toxic fumes from the landfill site @WalleysL run by @RedIndustries2  The @EnvAgency have found multiple breaches but still operating #socialjustice  #toxic #waste #healthissue https://t.co/46NZiPGPPf

@EnvAgencyMids You suspended Clayton Hall Landfill‚Äôs permit when they had similar problems,which focused the operators efforts to fixing the odour issues.Why can‚Äôt this be done at Walley‚Äôs?The councillor said that was the single biggest action that made a difference #stopthestink
Wtf! @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids why do you keep on widening the goalposts?? Next stop...... PENALTY! @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink https://t.co/D9XUYSdshy https://t.co/XXPWGYLPgd

@Kevin_Healey @JuliaBradbury @GreenpeaceUK @DrAmirKhanGP Thank you so much @Kevin_Healey and @JuliaBradbury for helping us to raise awareness of the torture this landfill is causing. We have just had another kick in the teeth by @EnvAgencyMids who have found 5 more breaches but giving them more chances and no fines
@StinkStopthe https://t.co/3y2IbdeZqC

tweets.text: @SarahInNUL @AaronBell4NUL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe It has come to my attention that the Blaydon closure was only temporary, but still, it was more robust enforcement than accepting a voluntary curtailment. Also, I suspect complaint numbers were similarly low for Dorket Head, which was closed permanently (https://t.co/LA0nxaHykq).

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency ‚ÄòWe can learn a huge about community health‚Äô just not about regulating @RedIndustries2 Walley‚Äôs Landfill site or the @PHE_uk health of thousands in @NewsNBC Newcastle under Lyme - @pow_rebecca @AaronBell4NUL what next? tweets.text: How many more chances? How much more time are you going to give ü§¨@EnvAgencyMids !? Clearly running a right sh*t show. Beyond a joke now. #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/Tt1boPNrjr

@DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Just when are you going to stop this torment in North staffordshire , 10 thats 10 permit breaches in 5 months  by @RedIndustries2 . If you get 10 breaches of your driving licence what happens  ??? yes banned !!! @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink

Thank you @SarahInNUL for compiling this. @EnvAgencyMids, please can you explain what technical, legal or financial challenges are unique to Walleys Quarry Landfill that prevent you from taking the same enforcement action? We're an understanding bunch, we just want to know why. https://t.co/yBdiMmY6Ag

No surprise there then as so many of us struggle to breathe. Thanks for continuing to support your local community @BBCRadioStoke Do we know what the permit breaches are yet? Sure the @EnvAgency will be fining them this time ... üôÑ#stopthestink https://t.co/xoXBrvY0Bi

@DrMickSalt @AaronBell4NUL @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Plenty more where that came from. Clayton Hall landfill... 1055 complaints in 3 months. Result = enforced closure by the EA. https://t.co/xPeEt4wRZG

A PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY!! What else needs to be said? Does someone need to lose their life before action is taken? @EnvAgencyMids & @PHE_uk lost trust of the local residents. Government need to step in and fund to resolve this one! @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/NR18B9vDfA

It is not getting any better. The gas stink from the landfill is increasing in intensity. A dreadful weekend and again tonight. No one should have to live like this. We are all looking for answers from @EnvAgencyMids and light at the end of this tunnel. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/JPdHJZJBqQ

The air in my house is thick with landfill fumes tonight. Again. There‚Äôs nowhere to hide from it. You cannot expect us to keep living like this @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe #WalleysQuarry #StopTheStink
Can the same department look into @RedIndustries2 with walleys quarry H2S emissions? @BBCNews @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk #StopTheStink https://t.co/a4UdCnh3i7

urls.title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs terrifying‚Äô: the English village overwhelmed by landfill stink | Landfill | The Guardian
urls.description: For miles around Walleys Quarry near Newcastle-under-Lyme, people have reported waking up in the night struggling to breathe

tweets.text: A community in Staffordshire are living with doors & windows taped up.Nose bleeds, breathing issues, toxic fumes from the landfill site @WalleysL run by @RedIndustries2  The @EnvAgency have found the company  'in breach' but v little action #socialjustice  https://t.co/DehURqq0oi

#LoveMyRiverChorley out on Carr Brook today, river surveys and enjoying the sunshine. Great group of volunteers too. @GroundworkCLM @DouglasPilot @EnvAgencyNW @ChorleyCouncil @HelenLDix https://t.co/XFihe5aOjY

urls.title: Testing and sequencing of sewage ramped up to help tackle COVID-19 outbreaks
urls.description: The innovative programme to test wastewater for traces of coronavirus (COVID-19) has ramped up sequencing capacity to support variant detection.

tweets.text:
Measurements in sewage have been mapping the spread of Covid variants across England, including the Indian variant 617.2

Read how this works, and examples of how its been used in Luton and Bristol: https://t.co/bk5ULdMUUk

Great work of @EnvAgency & @CefasGovUK scientists

tweets.text: Felt dreadful yesterday to the point I couldn't work in the later afternoon, little sleep last night. Today = sore throat, eyes, tongue,affecting voice. Chewing on pollution @ClareDinnisEA the levels speak for themselves, there is precedent to close and sort this! #stopthestink

@davemh72 @JuliaBradbury @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK The @EnvAgency are covering up one of the biggest environmental and health disasters this country has seen. @SianieRoo @JuliaBradbury @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK This is just my opinion , but maybe the EA are covering their tracks over something they've missed Red doing thats shall we say was not quite legal .

@JuliaBradbury @davemh72 @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK It‚Äôs starting to feel like a cover up Julia, high levels of methane as well and particulate matter which can be very hazardous to health.They think we will pipe down but we won‚Äôt. Our children‚Äôs health & futures are at stake #stopthestink

There have been five further permit breaches at Walleys Quarry landfill in Newcastle, which has been at the centre of thousands of complaints about a smell. 

The Environment Agency has said the operators have been told to carry out more works. https://t.co/xbcclA1so6

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Great British Railway Journeys
entity.description: Cartographer George Bradshaw produced the first comprehensive timetable and travel guide of Great Britain's railway system in 1840. Armed with his Bradshaw's Guide, presenter Michael Portillo travels around the country by train exploring the ways that society and industry have changed since the guide was first published during the Victorian era. In each destination Michael visits local landmarks, meets residents, enjoys local food, and tries his hand at local crafts and manufacture, and considers the legacy of the industrial revolution as he makes he way across the country.
